body:
```
# gmake test
Running tests...
/usr/local/bin/ctest --force-new-ctest-process 
Test project /usr/ports/net-im/tox/work/c-toxcore-0.1.6
      Start  1: TCP
 1/18 Test  #1: TCP ..............................***Failed   28.44 sec
      Start  2: conference
 2/18 Test  #2: conference .......................***Failed   80.01 sec
      Start  3: crypto
 3/18 Test  #3: crypto ...........................   Passed    2.13 sec
      Start  4: dht
 4/18 Test  #4: dht ..............................   Passed   32.69 sec
      Start  5: encryptsave
 5/18 Test  #5: encryptsave ......................   Passed    1.31 sec
      Start  6: messenger
 6/18 Test  #6: messenger ........................   Passed    0.02 sec
      Start  7: network
 7/18 Test  #7: network ..........................***Failed    0.06 sec
      Start  8: onion
 8/18 Test  #8: onion ............................   Passed   13.20 sec
      Start  9: resource_leak
 9/18 Test  #9: resource_leak ....................   Passed   13.06 sec
      Start 10: save_friend
```
It hangs at this point.

comment_data.body:
When running cmake, add `-DTEST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS=120 -DDEBUG=ON -DASAN=ON -DTRACE=ON` to arguments, and before running tests, do
```sh
export CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE=1
```

This will print a lot more more information and limit the runtime of each test to 120 seconds (the default is something ridiculous like 25 minutes).

Here are more details. One failure is because of the lack of IPv6, but the rest are real failures and timeouts.

Tried to reproduce in a FreeBSD 11.0 VM, but can't get toxcore to build. I have fixed the network headers, the part I get stuck on is

```sh
[ 35%] Linking C executable auto_toxav_many_test
/usr/local/bin/cmake -E cmake_link_script CMakeFiles/auto_toxav_many_test.dir/link.txt --verbose=1
/usr/bin/cc   -std=c99 -pedantic -Wall -Wextra -Weverything -Wno-cast-align -Wno-conversion -Wno-covered-switch-default -Wno-disabled-macro-expansion -Wno-documentation-deprecated-sync -Wno-format-nonliteral -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-missing-prototypes -Wno-padded -Wno-parentheses -Wno-return-type -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-sign-conversion -Wno-tautological-constant-out-of-range-compare -Wno-type-limits -Wno-undef -Wno-unreachable-code -Wno-unused-macros -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-vla -Wno-assign-enum -Wno-bad-function-cast -Wno-double-promotion -Wno-gnu-zero-variadic-macro-arguments -Wno-packed -Wno-reserved-id-macro -Wno-shadow -Wno-shorten-64-to-32 -Wno-unreachable-code-return -Wno-used-but-marked-unused -g3 -fsanitize=address -isystem /usr/local/include -isystem /usr/local/include/opus -isystem /usr/local/include -isystem /usr/local/include   CMakeFiles/auto_toxav_many_test.dir/auto_tests/toxav_many_test.c.o  -o auto_toxav_many_test  -L/usr/local/lib -Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/lib:/root/c-toxcore/build  libtoxencryptsave.so.1.6.0 -lcheck libtoxav.so.1.6.0 libtoxcore.so.1.6.0 libtoxgroup.so.1.6.0 libtoxmessenger.so.1.6.0 libtoxfriends.so.1.6.0 libtoxnetcrypto.so.1.6.0 libtoxdht.so.1.6.0 libtoxnetwork.so.1.6.0 libtoxcrypto.so.1.6.0 -lsodium -lrt -lopus -lvpx -lm
/usr/bin/ld: undefined reference to symbol `__cxa_demangle@@CXXABI_1.3' (try adding -lcxxrt)
//lib/libcxxrt.so.1: could not read symbols: Bad value
cc: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
gmake[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/auto_toxav_many_test.dir/build.make:106: auto_toxav_many_test] Error 1
```

This is because of this unmerged PR: https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/473
This patch makes it to compile on FreeBSD.
No, I have that patch applied. This is some other issue.
Remove -fsanitize=address - it is broken on FreeBSD.

Ok, that worked.

For everyone else reading, `-fsanitize=address` is added by `-DASAN=ON` cmake option, so just remove that option if you use it.

Kind of weird that asan doesn't work out of the box with clang though, is the clang built with asan disabled in FreeBSD?

> Kind of weird that asan doesn't work out of the box with clang though, is the clang built with asan disabled in FreeBSD?

This is a bug. They know and work on it.
Could you please commit the change (if not yet) that builds on FreeBSD out of the box, with this patch applied? Currently toxcore port isn't up-to-date partly because of this.
What you are asking is for https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/473 to be merged, right?
Yes. It has conflicts now. So if you could commit something equivalent, that would be great.

From the quick look at tests, it might be some networking issue. For example, the save_friend test is an infinite loop that breaks only when connection is established, and name and status message are exchanged https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/auto_tests/save_friend_test.c.

~~~@iphydf do you have any idea why the save_friend does any networking at all? Shouldn't it just create a Tox instance, set name and status mesaage on it, get the savedata bytes, create a second Tox instance off the savedata bytes and verify that the name as status message are the same?~~~ Ok, the test is fine, I misunderstood what the test was supposed to test.
Same failures on FreeBSD for the tests suite with v0.1.11 - but toxic, qtox and utox work correctly.
I've ran the test suite on freebsd successfully several times now. I'll soon work on making it run on travis as well. I think this bug is fixed. Reopen if it's not.

title: Testsuite fails and hangs on FreeBSD
